intro: Diplodium tylosum, commonly known as the woolly Diplodium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in compact clusters, which bloom in the spring. Diplodium tylosum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitat.
